headline: HaryanaChief Minister Nayab Saini during the swearing-in ceremony
description: Nayab Singh Saini took oath as Haryana’s Chief Minister, marking a strategic BJP shift ahead of elections. He pledged inclusive governance, youth jobs, and rural development.
content:
In a significant political development, Nayab Singh Saini was officially sworn in as the Chief Minister of Haryana during a grand ceremony held at the Raj Bhavan in Chandigarh. The event, attended by senior BJP leaders, MLAs, bureaucrats, and hundreds of supporters, marks a pivotal moment in the state’s political history.

 Saini, a prominent OBC leader known for his grassroots connect and administrative experience, has been chosen by the Bharatiya Janata Party to lead Haryana ahead of the upcoming elections, signaling a shift in the party’s strategic direction. His swearing-in was not only ceremonial but symbolic, with massive celebrations, fluttering party flags, and live coverage across the region. Hailing from Ambala, Saini’s rise from a humble background to the Chief Minister’s chair reflects his long political journey and dedicated service in various ministerial roles. As the crowd cheered during his oath of office administered by Governor Bandaru Dattatreya, Saini promised inclusive governance, rural development, job opportunities for youth, and improvement in law and order. With growing unrest among farmers, youth unemployment, and regional disparities, Saini faces tough challenges ahead, but his first speech made it clear that he intends to act swiftly. He emphasized development, transparency, and unity, echoing Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s vision of “Sabka Saath, Sabka Vikas.” Political analysts believe this move aims to consolidate non-Jat votes and rejuvenate the party’s image. On the ground, citizens expressed optimism, especially in Ratia and nearby towns. Residents praised his accessibility and hoped for better infrastructure, education reforms, and rural schemes. The oath ceremony and his appointment mark not just a leadership change, but a calculated shift to strengthen BJP’s narrative in Haryana’s evolving political battlefield.
